item.title: Notes
item.description:
Talks

  • Hilbert Class Field and Artin’s Symbol (en español) This lecture was part of the seminar on Explicit Class Field Theory taught in the first semester at PUC. It introduces the concepts of place, ramification, Hilbert class fields, and the Artin symbol.

  • On the problem of the rank of the Mordell-Weil group This presentation covered my research conducted during my master’s program, delivered at the CIMPA School 2025 in Valparaíso.
item.content:encoded:
Talks

  • Hilbert Class Field and Artin’s Symbol (en español) This lecture was part of the seminar on Explicit Class Field Theory taught in the first semester at PUC. It introduces the concepts of place, ramification, Hilbert class fields, and the Artin symbol.

  • On the problem of the rank of the Mordell-Weil group This presentation covered my research conducted during my master’s program, delivered at the CIMPA School 2025 in Valparaíso.

Seminars

  • Seminar on Galois representations and their $L$-functions (en español) 2023-2

  • Seminar of Number Theory (en español) 2024-2

Extras

  • Assistantships Number Theory 2024-2

  • Undergraduate’s thesis

  • J.-P. Serre. Abelian $\ell$-adic representations and elliptic curves
    This book, published originally in 1989 by Addison-Wesley, is a classic onewith two main issues for future diffusion: the first being that it is out of print; and the second being that it is written in typewriter machine, which can be aesthetically repulsive to certain readers. The need for this book is that modern texts on elliptic curves or abelian varieties don’t go deep enough on the subject (including Silverman’s Advanced topics…), while it is still acknowledged as obligatory for investigation purposes.

    Alongside José Cuevas Barrientos we decided to perform the project of re-typing it in modern LaTeX, while still maintaining most of the original style. The project is still ongoing, but you can download the temporary pdf file here

item.description: • H. Pasten, R. Sepúlveda-Manzo, On the $abc$ and the $abcd$ conjectures. Preprint (2024) (arXiv)

item.title: Number Theory (Teaching assistant)
item.description:
Notes and exercise

Description The course of Number Theory dicted by Héctor Pasten in 2024-2 has

In the number theory course taught by the professor Héctor Pastén in 2024, where I was the teaching assistant, they had tutorial sessions focused on solving exercises. Additionally, I had the freedom to propose research topics for the reports, which were the primary method of assessment for the course. Below are the notes and exercises from the research topics proposed for this undergraduate course
item.content:encoded:
Notes and exercise

Description The course of Number Theory dicted by Héctor Pasten in 2024-2 has

In the number theory course taught by the professor Héctor Pastén in 2024, where I was the teaching assistant, they had tutorial sessions focused on solving exercises. Additionally, I had the freedom to propose research topics for the reports, which were the primary method of assessment for the course. Below are the notes and exercises from the research topics proposed for this undergraduate course

  • Ayudantía 1 Divisibilibad y Funciones Multiplicativa
  • Ayudantía 2 Distribución de primos
  • Ayudantía 3 Fracciones continuas y Aproximación diofantina
  • Ayudantía 4 Ecuación de Pell
  • Ayudantía 5 Introducción a los $p$-ádicos
  • Ayudantía 6 SAGE y la conjetura $abc$
  • Ayudantía 7 SAGE y Curvas elípticas
  • Ayudantía 8 Altura y aritmética dinámica

item.title: Seminar of Number Theory
item.description:
Seminar of Number Theory (2024-2)

Organizers Héctor Pastén and Rocío Sepúlveda Manzo

Description The seminar

Schedule 2024-2 The seminar was held on Fridays at 14:00 pm in Room 2 of the Faculty of Mathematics, Pontificia Universidad Católica de Chile.

Talks

  • Talk 1 (10/11) Rodrigo Galaz: Introducción a la Conjetura de Mordell I
  • Talk 2 (10/18) Héctor Pastén: Introducción a la Conjetura de Mordell II
  • Talk 3 (10/25) Matías Alvarado: Hacia el teorema de Chabauty
  • Talk 4 (11/08) Siddhi Pathak (invited speaker, Chennai): On the zeros of variants of Ramanujan polynomials
  • Talk 5 (11/15) Rocío Sepúlveda-Manzo: Teorema de Chabauty
  • Talk 6 (11/22) Héctor Pastén: Preliminares para Manin-Dem’janenko
  • Talk 7 (11/29) José Cuevas-Barrientos: Demostración de Manin-Dem’janenko y aplicaciones
  • Talk 8 (12/06) Matías Bruna (invited speaker, UofT): Sobre la representación de enteros como suma de cuadrados.
  • Talk 9 (12/19) Dino Lorenzini (invited speaker, UGA): Resolution of wild $\mathbb{Z} / p \mathbb{Z}$-quotient singularities

© Rocío Sepúlveda Manzo | Made with Bear Cub

item.title: Seminar on Galois Representations
item.description:
Seminar on Galois Representations and their $L$-functions (2023-2)

Organizers Héctor Pastén and Rocío Sepúlveda Manzo

Description The seminar on Galois Representations and their $L$- functions aims to learn tools from group representation theory with an emphasis on applications to number theory, specifically oriented towards the Tate Conjecture.

Schedule 2023-2 The seminar was held on Fridays at 9:40 am in Room 5 of the Faculty of Mathematics, Pontificia Universidad Católica de Chile.
item.content:encoded:
Seminar on Galois Representations and their $L$-functions (2023-2)

Organizers Héctor Pastén and Rocío Sepúlveda Manzo

Description The seminar on Galois Representations and their $L$- functions aims to learn tools from group representation theory with an emphasis on applications to number theory, specifically oriented towards the Tate Conjecture.

Schedule 2023-2 The seminar was held on Fridays at 9:40 am in Room 5 of the Faculty of Mathematics, Pontificia Universidad Católica de Chile.

Talks (For now, the notes are in Spanish)

  • Talk 1 (01/09) Héctor Pastén: Introduction to Galois representations.
  • Talk 2 (08/09) Rocío Sepúlveda-Manzo: Galois Theory: Basic Tools.
  • Talk 3 (15/09) Rocío Sepúlveda-Manzo: Representations of Finite Groups: Basic Tools.
  • Talk 4 (22/09) Benjamín Castillo: Frobenius Element: Basic Constructions from Algebraic Number Theory.
  • Talk 5 (29/09) Matías Alvarado: Examples of Frobenius elements.
  • Talk 6 (13/10) Rocío Sepúlveda-Manzo: Dirichlet LLL-functions and their Analytical Properties.
  • Talk 7 (20/10) Rocío Sepúlveda-Manzo: Artin LLL-functions and their Analytical Properties.
  • Talk 8 (03/11) Patricio Pérez: Brauer’s Theorem for Induced Characters.
  • Talk 9 (17/11) Rocío Sepúlveda-Manzo: Artin Formalism.
  • Talk 10 (24/11) Héctor Pastén: Analytical Properties of Artin LLL-functions.

© Rocío Sepúlveda Manzo | Made with Bear Cub
